This is a friendly reminder to parents who have not yet submitted the New York State Digital Equity Survey to please submit by no later than this Friday June 12th. The survey was
emailed to all K-12 parents last week.

On Monday June 1, 2020 all districts received a request from New York State to help plan for Fall 2020 re-openings across the state. All districts were asked by New York State to provide the information below to New York State by next week. This data is needed from all school districts by New York State to plan for Fall 2020 re-openings.

If you have not already submitted the survey, please submit by this Friday. You submit a copy of the survey using the web-link emailed to all parents for *each* child you have enrolled in Chester Schools. So if you have three children, please fill in the survey using the link three times. If you have one child you would only need to fill in once.

Thank you very much. Go HAMBOs!

Robinson (15 show Broadway performer), Jarrad Green (Tony in West Side Story/Broadway Tour), attending NYC Broadway workshops, performances by Ithacappella and the Yale Spizzwinks, and performances by Jermaine Paul (winner of The Voice, 2012).

These are some photos from Ms. Bonito's class lesson at CES last week. Mr. Spence was invited to join the class to view this exciting lesson. Students worked in the new CES Makerspace, where they created a "Marble Maze." Ms. Bonito had defined the project and had her students work in groups to create their maze. After working in the CES Makerspace with Ms. Bonito and Ms. Rende the students returned to their classroom. The student then assessed each other's "Marble Maze" and provided feedback on how the design could be improved. This was a very exciting lesson and the students really seemed to gain a lot from it. Great job to Ms. Bonito, Ms. Rende and the students. Go HAMBOs!
